orinoco
Class Document

java.lang.Object
  orinoco.layout.BaseWriter
      orinoco.layout.DocumentLayout
          orinoco.Document
All Implemented Interfaces:
LayoutWriter, TextWriter
public class Document
extends orinoco.layout.DocumentLayout
implements TextWriter, LayoutWriter

The main API interface for the laying out and formatting of data Note that this is object requires two phase construction. The first phase instantiates the document, and then the client sets the headers and footers and performance other configuration calls. Then, when the document has been configured the client calls the open() method and starts writing out data, setting fonts and manipulating the actual contents. TRYING TO WRITE OUT DATA BEFORE THE open() METHOD HAS BEEN CALLED WILL RESULT IN A JAVA RUNTIME EXCEPTION

getFooter

public LayoutWriter getFooter()
                       throws java.io.IOException
Creates/gets the writer object enabling clients to specify the footer to be written at the end of each page. In order to create a footer, this method must be called and the footer written before the open() method is called on the document object If the footer is modified during the write process, the new footer will take effect after the next page break

Returns:
a writer to the footer object
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getHeader

public LayoutWriter getHeader()
                       throws java.io.IOException
Creates/gets the writer object enabling clients to specify the header for the beginning of each page. In order to create a header, this method must be called before the open() method. If the header is modified during the write process, the new header will take effect after the next page break

Returns:
a writer which writes to the page header
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getPageNumber

public int getPageNumber()
Accessor to get the current page number

Returns:
the current page number

getRemainingSpaceOnPage

public double getRemainingSpaceOnPage()
Gets the space left on the current page (in cm) once the header and footer heights have been taken into account. Client applications may need this information in order to determine that they need to throw a new page before subsequent text is written

Returns:
the available space left on the current page

getVersion

public static final java.lang.String getVersion()
Accessor to get the current version of the orinoco software

Returns:
the version string

newPage

public void newPage()
             throws java.io.IOException
Throws a new page. Automatically writes out any headers and footers

Throws:
java.io.IOException

open

public void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
Indicates that the document has been set up (with headers, footers etc) and that we are ready to begin. Writes out the necessary initialization data to the output file. NOTE: Trying to write write out data, set fonts etc. before this method has been called will throw a java runtime exception

Throws:
java.io.IOException
